channel.title: tv on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in tv on Barefoot Rob

item.title: Dirk Gently and the focused binge
item.description: 02:29 Saturday 13 January 2018 JST Heh. Well, it was pretty great. Dirk Gently’s Holistic Detective Agency was good enough that I just watched the last four (4) episodes in a row. At 40+ minutes each that’s 160+ minutes or about oh my god I have to go to bed. https://news.newonnetflix.info/news/dirk-gentlys-holistic-detective-agency-season-2-date-for-netflix-uk/ Now it is apparently canceled, but I hope not. https://variety.com/2017/tv/news/dirk-gently-2-1202644035/

item.title: the defenders
item.description: 17:12 Monday 28 August 2017 JST I watched episodes 2 and 3 of The Defenders today, some kinda expanded world offshoot from Danny Rand the Iron Fist. It’s good, but to quote Alfonzo, c’mon Iron Fist, let me sleep.

item.title: Tall man in Ueno station
item.description: 17:58 Thursday 27 July 2017 JST While I was walking out of Ueno station, a tall man and I did the foreigner nod and then he said he had seen me on TV (for being barefoot). We shook hands and talked for a bit about the importance of doing one’s own thing. He said, “I respect you,” and I should have said if he sees respectability in me, that means it’s in him, too.

item.title: end of year special YOUは何しに日本へ
item.description: 20:47 Tuesday 13 December 2016 JST Last night I met a whole lot of beautiful people who have been YOUs on the TV show “What are YOU doing in Japan?” I connected most with Cyrus the wild man, who loves onsen and apparently lives off grid.

item.title: just signed up for Netflix
item.description: 01:14 Tuesday 18 October 2016 JST The TV mysteriously broke while I was in OZ and Lin got a new one that supports Netflix, not just Hulu which we’ve liked for a long while, (and others we never used). Netflix is hella better than Hulu. can pause movies for a while without the stream being disconnected can fast forward and reverse with great control can see thumbnails larger than a postage stamp can see titles and descriptions in English can rate movies can get movie recommendations per different profile seems like a lot more variety of things to watch 5% less expensive Just turned on Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, and realize I’ve never seen it before!

item.title: Plan for today
item.description: 08:00 Saturday 27 February 2016 JST 9am - meet you barefoot at Kawasaki station 9am - 9:30am walk barefoot with you to my house 9:30am to 10:30am buy toilet paper wash laundry show computer working sign art for Gary hang laundry feed cats 10:30am to 11:30am go shopping at local shops I often visit buy bananas buy milk 11:30 - 12pm noon play barefoot in a park across the street from our house (there is no grass, but lots of gravel and some equipment I like to climb barefoot) 12:noon - 12:20pm quickly shower (you can film and see lots of dirt washing off my feet in the shower!

item.title: interviewed again for Tokyo TV
item.description: 16:03 Wednesday 03 February 2016 JST Yay! Upon our arrival in Narita, though Lin declined to be on camera, the guys from Tokyo TV interviewed me again! Fun! I wonder if they’ll actually follow me around at some point.. I imagine that would be a really interesting experience!

item.title: Barefoot me on TV
item.description: 15:12 Tuesday 29 December 2015 JST Okay so when I got back from OZ, upon arrival in Narita, I was approached by a TV crew who asked why I was barefoot and why I was coming to Japan. I wish I had just been honest, but I told them what I wished I was doing: traveling barefoot around the country for 3+ months. They were like, “wow so can we follow you around?
